spaceAsEducator.title: Space Shaping
spaceAsEducator.subtitle: Neuroarchitecture and Innovation Environment Design
spaceAsEducator.description: Space shapes people, people shape space—a bidirectional process. From neuroarchitecture to Third Space 2.0, understanding how physical environments affect cognition, behavior, and creativity.

extendedMind.title: Extended Mind
extendedMind.subtitle: AI-Enhanced Cognition and Learning Science
extendedMind.description: AI as cognitive exoskeleton—extending human capabilities rather than replacing human thinking. Exploring the optimal balance of human-AI collaboration and developing core competencies for the AI era.

emergentWisdom.title: Emergent Wisdom
emergentWisdom.subtitle: Community Dynamics and Collaborative Cognition
emergentWisdom.description: Communities are incubators of wisdom—individual intelligence is amplified, recombined, and evolved within communities. From psychological safety to cognitive diversity, understanding the emergence mechanisms of collective intelligence.

poeticsOfTechnology.title: Poetics of Technology
poeticsOfTechnology.subtitle: Embodied Tools and Post-Screen Era
poeticsOfTechnology.description: Technology should 'disappear'—the best technology makes you forget technology exists. From embodied learning to repairability, rethinking the relationship between tools and humans.

threeLayerNav.title: Knowledge System Navigation
threeLayerNav.description: Three interconnected knowledge layers, from philosophy to practice

footer.aiSpaceDesc: Intelligent documentation system built with Next.js and Fumadocs

M01.title: Philosophy & Theory
M01.subtitle: Planting the Seeds of Ideas
M01.description: Why build a maker space? Learning science provides the answer. From Dewey's 'learning by doing' to Seymour Papert's constructivism, from MIT Media Lab's 4P theory to IDEO's design thinking — these foundational theories converge on one insight: meaningful learning happens through authentic creation.
highlights: Constructivist Learning: Knowledge is actively constructed through hands-on practice, not passively received
4P Framework: Projects, Passion, Peers, Play — the four pillars of creative learning
Design Thinking Cycle: Empathize → Define → Ideate → Prototype → Test — cultivating real-world problem solvers

M02.title: Governance & Network
M02.subtitle: Weaving the Innovation Ecosystem
M02.description: A maker space is not an island but a node in an innovation ecosystem. Distributed governance breaks traditional hierarchies, enabling agile decisions and efficient collaboration. The Hub-Spoke-Satellite architecture creates network effects through resource sharing and knowledge flow.
highlights: Three-tier Node Architecture: Hub outputs standards, Spoke enables regional reach, Satellite extends flexibility
Agile Governance: Flat decision-making, transparent operations, community participation — everyone is a co-builder
Alliance Collaboration: Cross-institutional, cross-regional, cross-industry resource integration amplifying innovation impact

M03.title: Space & Environment
M03.subtitle: Space as the Third Teacher
M03.description: Reggio Emilia says 'space is the third teacher.' Physical space, digital environment, and cultural atmosphere form a trinity that shapes learning experiences. A great maker space isn't just about equipment — it sparks curiosity, lowers barriers to experimentation, and enables serendipitous connections.
highlights: Zoning Principles: Quiet thinking → Collaborative discussion → Hands-on making → Showcase sharing — a progressive spatial sequence
Digital Infrastructure: Network topology, cloud collaboration, version control, knowledge management — bridging online and offline
Visible Culture: Work walls, failure museums, progress boards — making learning visible and growth traceable

M04.title: Courses & Projects
M04.subtitle: Where Learning Truly Happens
M04.description: Curriculum is not a knowledge checklist but a carefully designed learning journey. Use Understanding by Design (UbD) to work backward from outcomes; apply Inquiry-Based Learning with real problems driving deep inquiry; integrate AI tools as learning accelerators rather than replacements.
highlights: Backward Design: Identify outcomes → Determine evidence → Design experiences — goal-driven curriculum development
Inquiry-Based Learning: Driving question → Sustained inquiry → Authentic product → Public showcase — learning through doing
AI-Enhanced Teaching: Generative AI for idea expansion, intelligent tutoring for personalization, data-driven learning analytics

M05.title: Tools & Assets
M05.subtitle: Bridging Ideas to Reality
M05.description: Tools are the soul of a maker space — from entry-level hand tools to professional CNC equipment, from open-source hardware to digital fabrication. A tiered management system ensures safety and control, lifecycle management maximizes asset value, and open ecosystems expand possibilities.
highlights: Equipment Tiers: L0 Free access → L1 Basic training → L2 Certified operation → L3 Expert supervision — progressive access control
Digital Fabrication Pipeline: 3D modeling → Slicing → Material selection → Manufacturing → Post-processing — design to reality
Open Hardware Ecosystem: Arduino, Raspberry Pi, ESP32 platforms with sensors, actuators, and communication modules

M06.title: Safety & Ethics
M06.subtitle: Guardrails That Set You Free
M06.description: Safety isn't restriction — it's the foundation for creative freedom. A three-layer architecture covers physical, digital, and ethical dimensions; risk-graded assessment enables targeted management; AI ethics guidelines set boundaries for emerging technologies. With guardrails, true exploration becomes possible.
highlights: Three-Layer Safety: Physical (equipment, materials, environment) → Digital (data, privacy, network) → Ethical (AI usage norms)
Risk Matrix: Likelihood × Severity assessment, Red/Orange/Yellow/Green alerts, precision resource allocation
AI Ethics Framework: Transparency, explainability, fairness, privacy protection — responsible technology guidelines

M07.title: People & Capability
M07.subtitle: Nurturing Those Who Ignite Others
M07.description: Maker mentors are not knowledge transporters but learning facilitators and creativity catalysts. E0-E3 capability levels map the journey from novice to expert, role matrices define responsibilities for mentors, technicians, and volunteers, and certification ensures professionalism and sustainability.
highlights: Capability Tiers: E0 Observe → E1 Assist → E2 Independent → E3 Mentor — a clear growth ladder
Role-Capability Matrix: Technical × Pedagogical × Community skills — multi-dimensional competency model
Certification Pathway: Beginner → Intermediate → Advanced → Expert — continuous learning and professional growth

M08.title: Operations Manual
M08.subtitle: Making Excellence Replicable
M08.description: Great operations don't rely on inspiration but on replicable systems. Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) ensure service consistency; membership systems drive sustained engagement; community culture cultivates belonging and creativity. From open days to workshops, mentor networks to knowledge sharing — every process is documented.
highlights: SOP Standards: Open day reception → Equipment usage → Project mentoring → Safety checks — operational guides for every scenario
Member Growth System: Newcomer → Learner → Member → Core → Mentor — progression with matched privileges and responsibilities
Culture Pillars: Openness, sharing, embracing failure, respectful collaboration — culture outlasts rules

M09.title: Assessment & Impact
M09.subtitle: Making Growth Visible
M09.description: Traditional assessment focuses on outcomes; maker education values process. Multi-dimensional assessment captures creativity, collaboration, and resilience — qualities hard to quantify. Growth portfolios document learning journeys; digital literacy profiles make development visible, traceable, and shareable.
highlights: Multi-Dimensional Assessment: Technical skills × Creative thinking × Collaboration × Reflection — holistic profiling beyond scores
Growth Portfolios: Project artifacts, process documentation, reflection journals, peer reviews — complete learning trails
Digital Literacy Profiles: Knowledge graphs, capability radars, growth curves, milestone badges — data-driven visualization
